title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99 per season, an add-on to the streaming service.
Non-subscribers to ESPN Unlimited can purchase MLB.TV for $149.99, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
MLB.TV automatic renewals remain through current accounts; new subscribers register via ESPN app, no ESPN Unlimited required after trial.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics forward Jayson Tatum participated in a practice session with the Maine Celtics, signaling progress in his rehab.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, noting he looked like himself despite his Achilles rehab.
Tatum has been practicing with G League and in five-on-five scrimmages, though his return date remains unspecified.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, with nearly 22% having advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in the rankings, while West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is being auctioned by Goldin Auctions, closing on February 21.
The card originally belonged to Morton Bernstein and has ties to Taunton, Massachusetts, where his family had a business.
Current bid for the card, ungraded and held by the family for 116 years, stands at $3.9 million, potentially reaching $4.758 million with fees.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut starting for Team USA against Denmark in 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman started in the 2025 IIHF World Championship, aiding Team USA to victory with a 5-0 record and a shutout.
Swayman has a 22-12-3 record, 2.92 GAA, and .903 save percentage in the 2025-26 season for the Boston Bruins.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old female right whale was found dead on a barrier island off Virginia's Eastern Shore.
This marks the second right whale death in two weeks, amidst an ongoing mortality event investigated by NOAA.
The deceased whale was the calf of Porcia; all of Porcia's calves have died, two from entanglements.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts reports a total of 260 flu-related deaths this season, including seven pediatric fatalities.
Recent state data indicates declining flu cases in February, but officials warn the virus continues to circulate.
State officials urge vaccination, especially for children, older adults, and those with health conditions.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department issued a humorous Valentine's Day post urging locals to report exes with outstanding warrants.
The Facebook post featured a flyer promising 'closure' through a police visit and received nearly 7,000 likes.
Similar initiatives have been observed in police departments from New Hampshire, Ohio, Nebraska, and New York.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer will practice at both 2B and 3B in Red Sox spring training.
Red Sox Manager Alex Cora aims to finalize infield positions, including third base, early this spring.
Boston emphasizes defensive improvement following MLB-leading 116 errors in 2025 season.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant will stay in New England, declining OC role interviews with other NFL teams.
Grant has significantly contributed to quarterback Drake Maye's development, boosting Maye's performance in his second season.
Patriots' coaching staff stability for Maye includes head coach Mike Vrabel, OC Josh McDaniels, and QBs coach Grant for 2026-27.
